Property.name: altFormats
Property.comment: Multiple date formats separated by '|' to try when parsing a user input value and it doesn't match the defined format (defaults to 'g:ia|g:iA|g:i a|g:i A|h:i|g:i|H:i|ga|ha|gA|h a|g a|g A|gi|hi|gia|hia|g|H').

Property.name: format
Property.comment: The default time format string which can be overriden for localization support. The format must be valid according to {@link Date#parseDate} (defaults to 'g:i A', e.g., '3:15 PM'). For 24-hour time format try 'H:i' instead.

Property.name: increment
Property.comment: The number of minutes between each time value in the list (defaults to 15).

Property.name: invalidText
Property.comment: The error text to display when the time in the field is invalid (defaults to '{value} is not a valid time').

Property.name: maxText
Property.comment: The error text to display when the time is after maxValue (defaults to 'The time in this field must be equal to or before {0}').

Property.name: maxValue
Property.comment: The maximum allowed time. Can be either a Javascript date object with a valid time value or a string time in a valid format -- see {@link #format} and {@link #altFormats} (defaults to null).

Property.name: minText
Property.comment: The error text to display when the date in the cell is before minValue (defaults to 'The time in this field must be equal to or after {0}').

Property.name: minValue
Property.comment: The minimum allowed time. Can be either a Javascript date object with a valid time value or a string time in a valid format -- see {@link #format} and {@link #altFormats} (defaults to null).
